Yahtzee API¶

Yahtzee API Class: Game¶

class yahtzee_api.game.Game(num_players)¶

Bases: object

Represents the larger game structure for Yahtzee.

Manages tracking and advancing global turns as well as initiating end-of-game scoring calculations. Creating a game will create a list of instances of the Player object according to the specified number of players passed to the constructor. All algorithm development should happen through an instance of this class as it provides a rule-adhering structure and allows access to the Player object and its methods.

remaining_turns¶

Global turn tracker.

Type

int

c_player¶

The current player.

Type

Player

num_players¶

Number of players in the game.

Type

int

winner¶

list populated at the end of the game with Player object(s) to store winner(s) (in case of a tie)

Type

list

next_player()¶

Advances to the next player and moves to the next global turn when the last player is detected.

Once the 13th turn is completed, this method will automatically calculate the final scores and set the value of self.winner to the winner(s) Player object(s).

print_final(file, overwrite=True)¶

Prints out the final results of the game to a specified file.

Parameters

  • file (str) – Filename to write to.

  • overwrite (bool, optional) – Whether or not to overwrite existing file data. Defaults to True.

print_status(file, overwrite=True)¶

Prints out the current moment-in-time status of the game to a specified file.

This should be called before a player chooses their score to view maximum detail. :param file: Filename to write to. :type file: str :param overwrite: Whether or not to overwrite existing :type overwrite: bool, optional :param file data. Defaults to True.:

Yahtzee API Class: Player¶

class yahtzee_api.player.Player(player_name)¶

Bases: object

Stores information about each player’s current status including score, theoretical score, rolls remaining in their turn, and the status of their last roll.

This class tracks the data associated with each player, and additionally performs all scoring calculations including all possible scores based on the current configuration of the dice and their scorecard. The Player object will expose all of the relevant information needed for algorithmic decision making, including a theoretical scorecard that gives all the possible scores based on what the player has already scored and the current configuration of the dice.

player_name¶

A string containing the name of the player.

Type

str

score¶

An integer value indicating the point total for the player (calculated at the end of the game).

Type

int

scorecard¶

A list of lists tracking each row of a Yahtzee scorecard, with each row (inner list) of the card following this structure: [score, [dice used to get score], number of rolls]. This is updated when a player ends their turn with the end_turn() method.

Scorecard indices are as follows:

[0]: 1’s

[1]: 2’s

[2]: 3’s

[3]: 4’s

[4]: 5’s

[5]: 6’s

[6]: Three of a Kind

[7]: Four of a Kind

[8]: Full House

[9]: Small Straight

[10]: Large Straight

[11]: Yahtzee

[12]: Chance

Type

list

t_scorecard¶

A list of lists tracking each row of a Yahtzee scorecard, calculated after each roll, with each row of the card following this structure: [score, [0 if index is unused, 1 if index is used], # of rolls]. This is calculated after every roll and can be used to make decisions about which dice to roll again, which score to take, and more.

Theoretical Scorecard indices are as follows:

[0]: 1’s

[1]: 2’s

[2]: 3’s

[3]: 4’s

[4]: 5’s

[5]: 6’s

[6]: Three of a Kind

[7]: Four of a Kind

[8]: Full House

[9]: Small Straight

[10]: Large Straight

[11]: Yahtzee

[12]: Chance

Type

list

dice¶

A list of the 5 dice in play - index is preserved throughout calculations.

Type

list

rolls_left¶

Integer tracking how many rolls the player has left on the current turn (there are 3 rolls per turn).

Type

int

jokers¶

Tracks how many times a Yahtzee was used as a Joker.

Type

int

end_turn(score_type)¶

Resets turn-based parameters and fills in scorecard based on player choice.

Parameters

score_type (int) – Index of the scorecard entry that the player has chosen to score for this round.

Raises

ValueError – If score_type is not between 0 and 12.

roll(to_roll)¶

Rolls dice specified by the to_roll list, updates related class attributes, and calculates the theoretical scorecard values.

Parameters

to_roll (list) – A list of length 5 containing binary values where 0 indicates the die in that position should be rolled.

Raises

  • ValueError – If the number of rolls remaining is <= 0.

  • TypeError – If to_roll is not a list.

  • ValueError – If the length of to_roll is not 5.

  • TypeError – If the to_roll list is not only binary values.

  • ValueError – If the player attempts to roll fewer than 5 dice on the first roll of their turn.
